Senior Principal AI Engineer, Product Security (REMOTE)

California, Virtual Address, United States

Full Time Senior-level / Expert USD 149K+
  • Website
  • LinkedIn
  • @Stryker_Jobs 𝕏
  • Search

Stryker

View all jobs at Stryker

Apply now Apply later

Posted 7 minutes ago

Work Flexibility: Remote

The (REMOTE) Senior Principal Product Data Security Engineer will be a valued professional on the Product Security team for Stryker’s Digital, Robotics, and Enabling Technologies organization. They will work with AI R&D product development, MLOps, quality, testing and regulatory team members to develop AI data security standards, data management practices, guidance, and policies for the development and sustainment of products incorporating secure artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) technologies.

What You Will Do

  • Participate in forums outside of Stryker to develop regulatory guidance for AI/ML applications in the medical device industry.

  • Provide guidance to AI and development teams to apply standards for the development, testing, training, tuning, and monitoring of AI and ML in medical devices on prem and hybrid multi-cloud platforms and technologies.

  • Provide guidance to product development teams on how to assess, prioritize, and resolve AI model, model data, and MLOps threats.

  • Experience with the AI Lifecycle, data security, and data management strategies.

  • Understanding of the NIST AI RMF, EU AI ACT, ISO 42001, and other related AI regulations and frameworks.

  • Lead and Influence across business units, seen as an expert advisor in the development of division design controls and risk documentation within the quality management system.

  • Lead cooperative efforts with IT Cybersecurity, R&D, Quality, Regulatory, marketing and project management to ensure success.

  • Identify and experience with development and utilization of technology and systems which enhance the company's product/process development performance.

  • Recommend procedural and process improvements and may provide resources or help to remove obstacles to team accomplishments.

  • Contribute to review and evaluation of technical performance.

What You Need (Required)

  • Bachelor's Degree in product security, computer science, engineering, or related disciplines

  • 10+ years of work experience.

  • 2+ years of relevant experience in applicable security or technical field.

​​Preferred

  • Master's Degree in security related discipline. (Preferred)

  • Understands quality management systems preferably in the healthcare or medical device industry. 

  • Experience implementing practices around data privacy, cybersecurity and able to apply to AI. 

  • One or more active, industry recognized, and relevant AI certifications, such as CISSP-AI, CMLSE, or Azure AI Engineer. 

$149,300-329,000 salary plus bonus eligible + benefits. Actual minimum and maximum may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience, and other relevant factors.

Travel Percentage: 30%

Stryker Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Stryker is an EO employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability.

Stryker Corporation will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.
